abstract: Editorial contends that critics of the Occupy Wall Street protesters are wrong to say they have no clear message and no solutions; argues that the message of the Occupy Wall Street protesters is that the income inequality in the nation is unacceptable; asserts that it is the job of the nation's leaders to find solutions and draft legislation, and had they been doing it all along the very legitimate public airing of grievances would not be necessary.
snippet: The protesters’ message is about an economy that is not working for most Americans. The problem is that no one in Washington has been listening.
lead_paragraph: The protesters’ message is about an economy that is not working for most Americans. The problem is that no one in Washington has been listening.

headline.print_headline: Protesters Against Wall Street: It’s obvious what they want. What took so long, and where are the nation’s leaders?
